Package gov.sandia.geotess

Class GeoTessMetaData

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.sandia.geotess.GeoTessMetaData
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GeoTessMetaDataEarthInterface
    public class GeoTessMetaData
extends java.lang.Object
    GeoTessMetaData stores basic information about a GeoTessModel. Each GeoTessModel has a single instance of MetaData that it passes around to wherever the information is needed.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      protected java.lang.String[] layerNames
      The names of each layer in the model, in order from the deepest to shallowest layer (increasing radius).
      protected int[] layerTessIds
      An array of length nLayers where each element is the index of the tessellation that supports the corresponding layer.

      Copy constructor.

        clone, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • layerNames

        protected java.lang.String[] layerNames
        The names of each layer in the model, in order from the deepest to shallowest layer (increasing radius).

      • layerTessIds

        protected int[] layerTessIds
        An array of length nLayers where each element is the index of the tessellation that supports the corresponding layer. Tessellation indexes are managed by the grid object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GeoTessMetaData

        public GeoTessMetaData()
        Default constructor.

        During construction of a GeoTessModel object, the following methods should be called to make the MetaData object complete.

        • setDescription()
        • setLayerNames()
        • setAttributes()
        • setDataType()
        • setLayerTessIds() (only required if grid has more than one multi-level tessellation)
        • setOptimization() (optional: defaults to SPEED)
        • setModelSoftwareVersion()
        • setModelGenerationDate()

      • GeoTessMetaData

        public GeoTessMetaData​(GeoTessMetaData md)
        Copy constructor. Make deep copies of all the values in md. Values are copied from md to this.
        Parameters:
        md - the other GeoTessMetaData object.

      • getModelLayerScannerHeader

        protected java.lang.String getModelLayerScannerHeader()
        Returns the model layer scanner header. The default is "layers: %s%n". Other meta data types may supply a different header if this method is overridden.
        Returns:
        The model layer scanner header. The default is "layers: %s%n". Other meta data types may supply a different header if this method is overridden.

      • getModelLayerString

        protected java.lang.String getModelLayerString()
        Returns the model layer string. By default this contains the ";" separated string of layer names. Other model types may include additional or different information if the method is overridden.
        Returns:
        The model layer string. By default this contains the ";" separated string of layer names. Other model types may include additional or different information if the method is overridden.

      • setModelLayers

        public void setModelLayers​(java.lang.String... layers)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Sets the model layers. This default simply calls the method setLayerNames. Other types of model may set additional information if this method is overridden.
        Parameters:
        layers - The input layers string array.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • checkComplete

        public void checkComplete()
                   throws GeoTessException
        Check to ensure that this MetaData object contains all the information needed to construct a new GeoTessModel. To be complete, the following information is required:
        • description
        • layer names
        • data type
        • attribute names and
        • attribute units.
        • model-population software name and version number
        • model generation date
        • if the model grid has more than one tessellation, then layerTessIds must also be specified.
        Throws:
        GeoTessException - if incomplete.

      • getNodeAttributes

        public AttributeDataDefinitions getNodeAttributes()
        Returns the models attribute name and unit specification defined by this model.
        Returns:
        The models attribute name and unit specification defined by this model.

      • getLayerTessIds

        public int[] getLayerTessIds()
        Retrieve a reference to layerTessIds; an int[] with an entry for each layer specifying the index of the tessellation that supports that layer.
        Returns:
        a reference to layerTessIds

      • setLayerTessIds

        public void setLayerTessIds​(int[] layerTessIds)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Set layerTessIds; an int[] with an entry for each layer specifying the index of the tessellation that supports that layer. For models that require only a single multi-level tessellation, this should be set to a an int array of length nLayers populated with all zeroes.
        Parameters:
        layerTessIds - the layerTessIds to set
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if layerTessIds.length != layerNames.length

      • getLayers

        public int[] getLayers​(int tessId)
        Retrieve a list of all the layer indexes that are associated with a specific tessellation index.
        Parameters:
        tessId - tessellation index
        Returns:
        a list of all the layer indexes that are associated with a specific tessellation index.

      • setDataType

        public void setDataType​(gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.DataType dataType)
        Specify the type of the data that is stored in the model. One of
        • DataType.DOUBLE
        • DataType.FLOAT
        • DataType.LONG
        • DataType.INT
        • DataType.SHORT
        • DataType.BYTE
        Parameters:
        dataType - the dataType to set

        public DataCustom getCustomDataType()
        Returns the current custom data type if set (null otherwise).
        Returns:
        The current custom data type if set (null otherwise).

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Standard toString method.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • toStringLayerNames

        protected void toStringLayerNames​(java.lang.StringBuffer buf)
        Outputs the layer name information to the input string buffer. Different model types may output different information if this method is overridden.
        Parameters:
        buf - The input string buffer into which the layer information is written.

      • isGridReuseOn

        public boolean isGridReuseOn()
        Return true if reuseGrids is turned on. GeoTessModel maintains a map from gridID -> GeoTessGrid object. If reuseGrids is on, then every time a model is loaded, the map is checked to see if that grid has been loaded already. If so, the new model gets a reference to the existing grid instead of loading and instantiating a new grid.

        By default, reuseGrids it true.

        Returns:
        true if reuseGrids is turned on.

      • setReuseGrids

        public void setReuseGrids​(boolean reuseGrids)
        GeoTessModel maintains a map from gridID -> GeoTessGrid object. If reuseGrids is on, then every time a model is loaded, the map is checked to see if that grid has been loaded already. If so, the new model gets a reference to the existing grid instead of loading and instantiating a new grid.

        By default, reuseGrids it true.

        Parameters:
        reuseGrids - specify true or false to turn reuseGrids on or off.

      • setModelFileFormat

        public void setModelFileFormat​(int modelFileFormat)
        Set the fileFormatVersion to use to write the current model. Defaults to whatever was used to read the model in the first place. For models not loaded from files, the fileFormatVersion number defaults to defaultModelFileFormat.

      • getEarthShape

        public gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.vector.EarthShape getEarthShape()
        Retrieve a reference to the ellipsoid that is currently being used to convert between geocentric and geographic latitude and between depth and radius. The following EarthShapes are supported:
        • SPHERE - Geocentric and geographic latitudes are identical and conversion between depth and radius assume the Earth is a sphere with constant radius of 6371 km.
        • GRS80 - Conversion between geographic and geocentric latitudes, and between depth and radius are performed using the parameters of the GRS80 ellipsoid.
        • GRS80_RCONST - Conversion between geographic and geocentric latitudes are performed using the parameters of the GRS80 ellipsoid. Conversions between depth and radius assume the Earth is a sphere with radius 6371.
        • WGS84 - Conversion between geographic and geocentric latitudes, and between depth and radius are performed using the parameters of the WGS84 ellipsoid.
        • WGS84_RCONST - Conversion between geographic and geocentric latitudes are performed using the parameters of the WGS84 ellipsoid. Conversions between depth and radius assume the Earth is a sphere with radius 6371.
        • IERS2003 - Conversion between geographic and geocentric latitudes, and between depth and radius are performed using the parameters of the IERS2003 ellipsoid.
        • IERS2003_RCONST - Conversion between geographic and geocentric latitudes are performed using the parameters of the IERS2003 ellipsoid. Conversions between depth and radius assume the Earth is a sphere with radius 6371.
        Returns:
        a reference to the EarthShape currently in use.

      • setEarthShape

        public void setEarthShape​(gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.vector.EarthShape earthShape)
        Set the EarthShape object that is to be used to convert between geocentric and geographic latitude and between depth and radius. The following EarthShapes are supported:
        • SPHERE - Geocentric and geographic latitudes are identical and conversion between depth and radius assume the Earth is a sphere with constant radius of 6371 km.
        • GRS80 - Conversion between geographic and geocentric latitudes, and between depth and radius are performed using the parameters of the GRS80 ellipsoid.
        • GRS80_RCONST - Conversion between geographic and geocentric latitudes are performed using the parameters of the GRS80 ellipsoid. Conversions between depth and radius assume the Earth is a sphere with radius 6371.
        • WGS84 - Conversion between geographic and geocentric latitudes, and between depth and radius are performed using the parameters of the WGS84 ellipsoid.
        • WGS84_RCONST - Conversion between geographic and geocentric latitudes are performed using the parameters of the WGS84 ellipsoid. Conversions between depth and radius assume the Earth is a sphere with radius 6371.
        • IERS2003 - Conversion between geographic and geocentric latitudes, and between depth and radius are performed using the parameters of the IERS2003 ellipsoid.
        • IERS2003_RCONST - Conversion between geographic and geocentric latitudes are performed using the parameters of the IERS2003 ellipsoid. Conversions between depth and radius assume the Earth is a sphere with radius 6371.
        Parameters:
        earthShape - reference to the EarthShape that is to be used

      • getGradientCalculatorTetSize

        public double getGradientCalculatorTetSize()
        When called upon to create a GradientCalculator object used to compute attribute field gradients, this is the size of the small tetrahedron used by the GradientCalculator to estimate attribute gradients. Units are km.
        Returns:
        The size of the GradientCalculator small tetrahedron.

      • setGradientCalculatorTetSize

        public void setGradientCalculatorTetSize​(double tetSize)
        When called upon to create a GradientCalculator object used to compute attribute field gradients, this value will be the size of the small tetrahedron used by the GradientCalculator to estimate the gradients. Units are km.
        Parameters:
        tetSize - The size of the GradientCalculator small tetrahedron.

      • useLayerNormalAreaWeight

        public boolean useLayerNormalAreaWeight()
        Returns true if layer normals are to be evaluated using facet area weighting for the facets that share a vertex at a layer boundary for which the layer normal is to be evaluated. If false, the facet normals contributing to the layer normal are averaged directly without weights.
        Returns:
        True if layer normal area weighting is on.

      • setLayerNormalAreaWeight

        public void setLayerNormalAreaWeight​(boolean lnaw)
        Sets the layer normal area weight flag. True implies adjacent facet normals shared by a common vertex for which the layer normal is to be evaluated are weighted by the facet area before summing and normalizing to produce the layer normal at the vertex.
        Parameters:
        lnaw - The new setting of the layer normal area weight flag.

      • getInterfaceIndex

        public int getInterfaceIndex​(java.lang.String... majorInterfaces)
        Retrieve the index of the interface with the specified name. If majorInterfaces can be parsed to an integer, then that value is returned. If not, then the index of the interface with the specified name is returned.

        If more than one name is supplied, the first one that can be successfully interpreted as either an integer index or a valid interface name is returned.

        The ability to supply alternative names is useful. For example, some models call the top of the crust "CRUST" while in other models the top of the crust is called "UPPER_CRUST". If both are requested using this method, the correct index will be returned.

        Parameters:
        majorInterfaces - String
        Returns:
        int

      • getGridInputFileName

        public java.lang.String getGridInputFileName()
        Return the name of the file from which the grid was loaded. Not the whole file path, just the name. If the grid was loaded from the same file as the model, return "*";

      • setGridInputFileName

        public void setGridInputFileName​(java.lang.String gridInputFileName)
        Set the name of the file from which the grid was loaded. Not the whole file path, just the name. If the grid was loaded from the same file as the model, specify "*";
